meanings.definition: An elaborate musical composition for full orchestra, typically in four movements.
meanings.sent1: The symphony performed by the orchestra was beautiful and grand.
meanings.sent2: I love listening to a symphony by Beethoven.
meanings.sent3: The symphony of flavors in the dish created a delightful experience for my taste buds.
meanings.sent4: The city at night was a symphony of lights and sounds.
meanings.sent5: The symphony of colors in the painting was mesmerizing.

meanings.sent1: The garden was a symphony of blooming flowers and buzzing bees.
meanings.sent2: The team worked together in perfect symphony to complete the project.
meanings.sent3: The symphony of laughter and chatter filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky in a symphony of warm hues.
meanings.sent5: The dance performance was a symphony of graceful movements and music.
